definition: to leap and frisk about (idiom); lively/healthy and active
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary
to jump/to hop/to skip over/to bounce/to palpitate

sentences.english: Well, I am still alive and kicking .
sentences.chinese: 你看，我还是活蹦乱跳的。

sentences.english: Turkish democracy is alive and kicking.
sentences.chinese: 土耳其的民主是活蹦乱跳的。

sentences.english: Three, value of energy?The some cat live to leap disorderly jump, have of geniality muff.
sentences.chinese: 重视它的精力吗？有的猫活蹦乱跳，有的则温和迟钝。

sentences.english: The carp were alive and kicking when they were dragged out of the river.
sentences.chinese: 这些鲤鱼从河里拖上来时活蹦乱跳的。

sentences.english: Look , he is alive and kicking again.
sentences.chinese: 瞧瞧他，又活蹦乱跳的了。

sentences.english: These lively children keep you on your toes.
sentences.chinese: 这些活蹦乱跳的孩子就够你成天忙碌了。

sentences.english: Can Jackanapes be merry when his clog is at his heel?
sentences.chinese: 猴子脚跟上绑了坠子，还能快乐地活蹦乱跳吗？

sentences.english: Life is short. You have a limited number of days on this Earth.
sentences.chinese: 人生苦短，你能在这个世界上活蹦乱跳的日子并不长。

definition: lit. lively dragon and animated tiger (idiom)/fig. vigorous and lively
to bounce/to jump/to hop/also variant of 蹦達|蹦达[beng4 da2]
looking or feeling sickly/weak and dispirited through illness
to nod one's head and wag one's tail (idiom)/to be well pleased with oneself/to have a lighthearted air
to jump about/(of the heart) to beat wildly
